parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "ISIC2020_1_ResNet152V2_150h_150w",
    "partition": "haehn",
    "queue": "haehn_unlim",
    "node": "chimera12",
    "cores": 6,
    "memory": "200gb",
    "gpu": "A100",
    "gpu_count": 1,
    "time_limit": "01-00:00",
    "output_file": "/home/sanghyuk.kim001/MELANOMA/melanoma-detection-CNN/SLURMS/LOGS/ResNet152V2/%x_%A_%a.out",
    "error_file": "/home/sanghyuk.kim001/MELANOMA/melanoma-detection-CNN/SLURMS/LOGS/ResNet152V2/%x_%A_%a.err",
    "conda_environment": "clean_chimera_env",
    "python_version": "python --version",
    "cuda_version": "nvcc -V",
    "script_path": "/home/sanghyuk.kim001/MELANOMA/melanoma-detection-CNN/train.py",
    "database": "ISIC2020",
    "image_size": "150x150",
    "classifier": "ResNet152V2",
    "self_augmentation": 1,
    "job_index": "$SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID"
  }
}
```

This script is running under the **SLURM** workload manager. 

**Details:**

* It submits a job named "ISIC2020_1_ResNet152V2_150h_150w" to the "haehn" partition on the "haehn_unlim" queue, specifying the node "chimera12".
* The job requires 6 cores, 200 GB of memory, and one A100 GPU. 
* The script uses a conda environment named "clean_chimera_env" for dependencies.
* The script uses the "train.py" script to train a ResNet152V2 classifier on the ISIC2020 database using images resized to 150x150. It also uses self-augmentation and sets the job index using the SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID environment variable. 

This script leverages SLURM for resource management and a conda environment for dependency management. It uses Python to execute the training process, requiring a compatible Python interpreter and NVIDIA CUDA for GPU acceleration.
